paper.title: Solving a Problem in Relevance Logic with an Automated Theorem Prover
paper.abstract: A new challenging problem for automated theorem provers (ATP) is presented. It is from the field of relevance logic and is known as “converse of contraction”. We firstly give some background informatlon about relevance logic and the problem itself and then discuss a proof for the theorem which has been found by the Markgraf Karl Refutation Procedure (MKRP), a resolution based theorem prover, under development at the Universities of Karlsruhe and Kaiserslautern.
